components.description:
A horseshoe magnet, as used to pick up iron. Depicted at various angles in red with silver-tipped poles.

Commonly used for various content concerning literal and figurative magnetism and attraction. May also be used in various science-related contexts more generally.

Twitter’s design features two electric bolts coming from its poles. WhatsApp’s horseshoe is half blue, denoting an opposite magnetic pole.
components.title: Magnet

version.description:
Unicode 11.0 was released on June 5, 2018. Emojis that require new code points for release are listed on this page but for the full 2018 emoji list see Emoji 11.0.

Emoji 11.0 includes every new emoji, including variations for skin tone, gender and new emojis that don't require additional code points, such as the chess pawn or pirate flag which are not shown on this page.
